thread.title: ALUMNI NOTEBOOK: Lormand reaches 1,500 points, a first in St. Thomas history
thread.title_full: ALUMNI NOTEBOOK: Lormand reaches 1,500 points, a first in St. Thomas history

author: Rob Tate, rtate@hcnonline.com
title: ALUMNI NOTEBOOK: Lormand reaches 1,500 points, a first in St. Thomas history
text:
St. Thomas basketball player Maghen Lormand.A 2012 The Woodlands graduate. St. Thomas basketball player Maghen Lormand.A 2012 The Woodlands graduate. Photo: St. Thomas Sports Information ALUMNI NOTEBOOK: Lormand reaches 1,500 points, a first in St. Thomas history 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Maghen Lormand has made her mark on the record book playing for the University of St. Thomas in Houston. 
The 2012 The Woodlands High School graduate reached a milestone this past Saturday that no other women's basketball player for the Celts has ever reached. 
With 16 points scored against Jarvis Christian, Lormand became the first in program history to surpass the 1,500-career point mark. 
"Maghen has worked very hard to be a leader and a player that is respected. To achieve such a great milestone is just the reward of that hard work." St. Thomas coach Jan Cross said in a press release. "For only being around her for the past two seasons I can say that she demands a lot of herself and her teammates but she also shows that she cares about the school, the team and where the program is going." 
Lormand missed the entire 2014-15 season due to injury, but returned last year to average 14.3 points per game, earning her first team All Red River Conference honors. The former Lady Highlander entered this season with 1,204 career points. 
Lormand opened this season scoring 27 points in the opener against Arlington Baptist College . Four games later against Texas Wesleyan, she netted a season-high 28 points. 
The 6-foot forward leads the Celts in scoring average at 18 points per game, eight more than the next player. She also leads the team in rebounding at 8.2 per game. 
Two other Montgomery County players are on St. Thomas, both of which are from Magnolia. 
Senior guard Tori Frederick has started 12 games and is averaging 3.9 points per game. She has 31 assists and nine steals. Taylor Bearden is also a former Lady Bulldog and has appeared in just one game as a freshman. 
The Celts are 9-8 on the season and 5-4 in conference play. 
MORE WOMEN'S BASKETBALL 
Malloree Schurr (Montgomery) has started all 20 games and has scored 68 points so far during her junior season. The former Lady Bear is averaging 19.1 minutes per game is averaging 4.4 rebounds with 14 assists and 10 steals. 
The Bucaneers are 11-9 on the season and 3-2 in the Southern Conference. 
WOMEN'S SOCCER 
Briana Woodall (Porter) was announced on Monday as a transfer to Sam Houston State University . Woodall spent her freshman year at Oklahoma State where she appeared in 13 games as a midfielder and scored one goal and added one assist. Woodall was The Courier's All-County Co -Most Valuable Player in 2016 after scoring 34 goals and assisting on 33 as a senior for the Lady Spartans. Subscribe to HCN
